content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The instruction is clear and the test cases are solvable as well, the test is solvable within the given time.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: ça me parait tout à fait dans l'esprit de codingame :-)

Goal section
* Please change "strings" to "scores".

* Please change "numbers" to "digits".

* Please change "its" to "it's" (or better yet, "it is").

Input section
* Please change "Score" to "scores".

* Please mention here (not in Constraints section) that the format of both lines is [[name]]{{:}}[[scores]] where [[scores]] are separated by {{-}}.

Output section
* Please format "draw" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Cases
* It feels odd when the names of the competitors are classified as [[variables]] in Input section but are actually constants as they are the same throughout all the cases. Suggest to change the names so that the names used are different across all the cases.

Constraints section
* After the above changes are implemented, please change the first constraint to:
1 <= number of [[scores]] for each competitor <= 5

* The second constraint is violated in the 3rd pair of cases. Please fix either the constraint or the cases.

Thanks.

Thank you for your feedback i tried to update everything . Also i kept in mind if it would be too hard for reverse engineering if i put a N in the first line and n competitors with their scores in the upcoming n lines what do you think?

Thank you for making the changes. Regarding your question, I think it's a bit difficult to guess the requirement in Reverse mode; but to improve that:

* There must be at least one more simple pair of cases to hint that it is wrong to assume that just summing up the digits is the right approach. (You aren't restricted to 4 pairs of cases.)

* The first few pairs of cases would deal with 2 competitors only, and then the later pairs can deal with more.

Comments on the updated clash:

Input section
* Please delete "Assume that the competitors have different names."

Constraints section
* Please delete the first constraint.

* Please add:

   • 1 <= each of the [[scores]] <= 9
   
   • [[name]] and [[name2]] are always different.

Cases
* A greater variety of names are needed. Or just swapping the names in the validators is an improvement already.

Stub generator
* Please update the variable names.

Thanks.

Thank you for your feedback. I changed the things you mentioned.
Also i thought it could become too complex maybe i will make a new harder competition.

As mentioned, if you would like to enable Reverse mode (even when all the cases are about 2 competitotrs), I would strongly suggest you to add at least one more simple pair of cases at the beginner to hint that it is wrong to assume that just summing up the digits is the right approach. (You aren't restricted to 4 pairs of cases.)

Also, please add "1 <= each of the [[scores]] <= 9" in Constraints action as per my last comment.

Thank you.
Added what was mentioned in constaint section and also added 2 testcases 1 obvious one and one where there is a different amount of numbers
So i changed the status to ready
